solution_line_template: She ordered {num_steaks} 1/2 pound steaks so that's {num_steaks}*{steak_weight_each} = <<{num_steaks}*{steak_weight_each}={total_steak_weight}>>{total_steak_weight} pounds of steak.

The steak cost ${steak_price_per_pound} a pound and she bought {total_steak_weight} pounds so that's {steak_price_per_pound}*{total_steak_weight} = $<<{steak_price_per_pound}*{total_steak_weight}={steak_total_cost}>>{steak_total_cost} for 4 steaks.

She also needed {chicken_weight} pounds of chicken breasts at ${chicken_price_per_pound} a pound so that's {chicken_weight}*{chicken_price_per_pound} = $<<{chicken_weight}*{chicken_price_per_pound}={chicken_total_cost}>>{chicken_total_cost} for chicken.

The steaks cost ${steak_total_cost} and the chicken cost ${chicken_total_cost} for a total of {steak_total_cost}+{chicken_total_cost} = $<<{steak_total_cost}+{chicken_total_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} spent at the butchers.
